    • Method Detail

      • setTargetNode

        public void setTargetNode()
        This method is an overrided method that set Pinky's target node depending on the mode.
        Overrides:
        setTargetNode in class GameObject

      • setClydeTargetNode

        public void setClydeTargetNode()
        This method will set Clyde's target destination. In this case, Blinky will always target Pacman's position.

      • scatter

        public void scatter()
        This method will influence the ghosts to move into scatter mode. This method will simply set the Ghost's new target node to their respective scatter corner. For Clyde specifically, he will target the bottom left corner.

      • move

        public void move()
        This method will update Clyde's current position using a "velocity", determined through a series of checks made by a bunch of other methods located in this method. he most important method used for this function to work is checkDirection().
        Overrides:
        move in class GameObject

      • chooseShortestDecision

        public void chooseShortestDecision()
        This method helps Clyde makes decision relative to its target node. It uses Euclidean distance as a heuristic and sorts all possible decisions (neighbouring Tiles - possible moves) using the heuristic to obtain the shortest (yet valid (as Ghosts cannot move backwards)) decision; this method works with scatter(). Note that Clyde, when found to have a heuristic score of less than 8 units close to Pacman, will cause Clyde to transition into scatter() mode (a personality trait of the ghost).
        Overrides:
        chooseShortestDecision in class GameObject

      • drawTarget

        public void drawTarget()
        A method to show Clyde's target destination; this is only used for debug mode.
        Overrides:
        drawTarget in class GameObject
